metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10033 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The mailSend function in the isMail transport in PHPMailer before 5.2.18might allow remote attackers to pass extra parameters to the mail commandand consequently execute arbitrary code via a \" (backslash double quote)in a crafted Sender property.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 5.2.14+dfsg-2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.14+dfsg-2.1').
